frameDefinitions: A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
A Perpetrator intentionally sets fire to his own or someone else's property, often in order to collect an insurance payment on this property.
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
A Material has been processed (generally industrially) to some Degree in order to make it more useful for some (usually implicit) function.

The words in this frame describe situations in which the Perpetrator secretly takes Goods into or out of a country or other area which are prohibited by law or on which one has not paid the required duty.
An Experiencer has an easy or difficult time carrying out an Activity.
frameExamples: Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The illegal setting of fire to destroy something.
The <fen>Perpetrator</fen> sets fire to a building in order to gain some benefit from so doing.
<fen>Victim</fen> identifies the enity that is negatively effected by the arson.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arson occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arson occurs.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
The substance which is altered in some useful way.
This is the person (or other agent) that illegally takes the goods into or out of a country.
The role Goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be illegally taken into our out of a country.
The source is the location the goods occupy initially before change of location.
The path refers to (a part of the) ground the Goods travel over or to a landmark the Goods travel by.
Goal is the location the Goods end up in.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.

This Frame Element marks expressions indicating the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> finds difficult or easy. In many cases, the relevant <fen>Activity</fen> has to be inferred from the context.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate which person judges carrying out the <fen>Activity</fen> to be easy or difficult.
The time at which the <fen>Activity</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
<fex>The two men</fex> were charged with arson when found running from the burning factory.
There has been an increase in the number of  arson attacks <fex>on local schools</fex>.
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
The geology question on the exam was hard <fex>for me</fex>.
